info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bladen and northeastern Columbus Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hallsboro, or 9 miles east of Whiteville, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Waccamaw, Sandyfield, Carvers, Hallsboro, Freeman, Council, Kelly, Bolton and East Arcadia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
